intro: Ischyrolepis coactilis, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is native to the high Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically pale green or white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the cold, high-altitude environments of its native habitat. Due to its specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
